intro: Crocodilodes insignis, commonly known as the African rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features small, green, succulent leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Crocodilodes insignis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
